newsitem.title: BURMA: Vietnam party chief arrives for Burma visit.
newsitem.headline: Vietnam party chief arrives for Burma visit.

text.p: Vietnamese Communist Party chief Do Muoi arrived to a ceremonial welcome in Rangoon for a four-day visit to boost bilateral ties.
Prime Minister and chairman of the ruling State Law and Order Restoration Council (SLORC), General Than Shwe, and other senior officials of the military government met the Vietnamese party leader.
Do Muoi was given a 21-gun salute after he inspected a guard of honour and thousands of school children lined the streets waving flags of the two countries as he drove to the state guest house.
Government sources have said Do Muoi was expected to discuss boosting bilateral ties and Burma's impending and controversial entry as a member of the Association of Southeast Asian Nations (ASEAN).

The seven-member group which include Thailand, Malaysia, Philippines, Singapore, Brunei, Indonesia and Vietnam, is expected to discuss Burma's possible entry into the bloc at a meeting in Malaysia on May 31.
Also in Do Muoi's 65-member delegation were Deputy Prime Minister Phan Van Khai and Foreign Minister Nguyen Manh Cam.
The two countries have formed a joint commission for bilateral cooperation and also signed agreements to cooperate in narcotics control and bilateral cooperation in forestry.
